page.title: 08LORDS OF THE MANOR
page.content: 1985 is the 500th anniversary of the founding of the Bray family dynasty at Shere. At the Battle of Bosworth, Reginald Bray was a supporter of Henry Tudor, and after the battle it was Reginald who found the crown in the thornbush; he was subsequently rewarded with,amongst other things, the manor of Shere. He was also made a Knight of the Garter,and was responsible for the completion of the nave of St.George's Chapel,Windsor, where the Bray crest,the hemp-bray,can be found 175 times within the nave. The Bray's have been Lords of the Manor of Shere for the past 500years without a break; Mrs.Handa Bray is the 15th Lord of the Manor.(It is a condition of the inheritance that the Lord of the Manor 'bears the name and arms of Bray.)The Bray estate covers 2,000acres in the surrounding area.
